metadata.title: Apex Documentation - Utility-First CSS Framework
metadata.description: Apex - A utility-first CSS framework with 500+ utility classes for rapid UI development

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Accessibility features in Apex CSS Framework including screen reader support, focus management, reduced motion preferences, and high contrast mode utilities.

wcagCompliance.title: WCAG Compliance
wcagCompliance.content: Apex is designed with accessibility in mind and aims to meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards. All accessibility utilities are optional and can be enabled or disabled via configuration.

screenReaderClasses.title: Screen Reader Classes
screenReaderClasses.description: Hide content visually while keeping it accessible to assistive technologies. These utilities follow the standard visually hidden pattern used across the web.

srOnly.title: .sr-only
srOnly.description: Hides an element visually while keeping it available to screen readers. Use this for text that should only be announced to assistive technologies, like icon-only buttons or decorative elements with meaningful content.

notSrOnly.title: .not-sr-only
notSrOnly.description: Makes an element visible again. Often used in combination with .sr-only to reveal content on focus, such as skip navigation links that become visible when focused.

focusable.title: .sr-only-focusable
focusable.description: Hides content visually but makes it visible when focused. Perfect for skip links that help keyboard users navigate directly to main content.

focusManagement.title: Focus Management
focusManagement.description: Apex provides focus management utilities for keyboard navigation. These help create clear, visible focus indicators that meet WCAG requirements.

focusVisible.title: Focus Visible (:focus-visible)
focusVisible.description: Apply styles only when an element receives focus via keyboard navigation (not on mouse click). This creates a cleaner experience for mouse users while maintaining accessibility for keyboard users.

focusWithin.title: Focus Within (:focus-within)
focusWithin.description: Apply styles to a parent element when any of its children have focus. Useful for highlighting form groups, cards, or containers when the user is interacting with contained elements.

skipLink.title: Skip Link (.skip-link)
skipLink.description: A pre-built skip link component that appears when focused, allowing keyboard users to bypass navigation and jump directly to main content. Position it as the first focusable element on the page.

reducedMotion.title: Reduced Motion
reducedMotion.description: Respect user preferences for reduced motion with media query-based utilities. These automatically respond to the prefers-reduced-motion system setting.

motionReduce.title: Motion Reduce
motionReduce.description: Remove animations, transitions, and transforms when the user has requested reduced motion. These classes are applied automatically via media query.

motionSafe.title: Motion Safe
motionSafe.description: Only apply styles when motion is safe (user has not requested reduced motion). Use these to opt-in to animations that might otherwise be distracting.

highContrast.title: High Contrast Mode
highContrast.description: Support for Windows High Contrast Mode and prefers-contrast media queries. These utilities help ensure your content remains accessible in high and low contrast environments.

contrastHigh.title: High Contrast
contrastHigh.description: Applied automatically when the user has selected high contrast mode. Adds borders and outlines using currentColor to ensure visibility.

contrastLow.title: Low Contrast
contrastLow.description: Applied when the user prefers low contrast. Uses subtler borders and outlines.

focusRings.title: Focus Ring Utilities
focusRings.description: Complete reference of focus ring and outline utilities available in Apex. All focus-visible utilities only apply on keyboard focus.
focusRings.ring: Default focus ring (3px) with blue color
focusRings.outlineNone: Remove default outline (use with custom focus styles)

bestPractices.title: Accessibility Best Practices
bestPractices.practice1: Always include visible focus indicators for interactive elements
bestPractices.practice2: Use .sr-only for text that describes icons or visual elements
bestPractices.practice3: Test with keyboard navigation and screen readers
bestPractices.practice5: Include a skip link as the first focusable element on the page

colorBlindTheme.title: Color Blind Friendly Theme
colorBlindTheme.description: Apex includes a built-in color blind friendly theme that adjusts the color palette to be more distinguishable for users with various types of color vision deficiencies.

whyItMatters.title: Why Color Blind Accessibility Matters
whyItMatters.description: Approximately 8% of men and 0.5% of women have some form of color vision deficiency. Using color blind friendly palettes ensures your interface remains usable and clear for these users.

howToUse.title: How to Use
howToUse.description: Apply the theme-colorblind class to your HTML element or any container to enable color blind friendly colors:

colorAdjustments.title: Color Adjustments
colorAdjustments.description: The color blind theme adjusts semantic colors to have more distinct luminance values and hue separations:

bestPractices.title: Best Practices for Color Accessibility
bestPractices.practice1: Never rely on color alone to convey information - always include icons or text labels
bestPractices.practice2: Use patterns or textures in addition to colors for charts and graphs
bestPractices.practice3: Test your designs with color blind simulation tools
bestPractices.practice4: Provide a toggle for users to enable color blind mode if desired

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: Accessibility utilities can be enabled or disabled in your SCSS configuration. By default, all accessibility features are enabled.

base.title: Base Styles
base.description: Foundation styles that provide a consistent baseline for your application. Includes CSS reset, normalize styles, element defaults, and design tokens.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Apex's base styles provide a solid foundation for your application. They include:
overview.cssReset: CSS Reset - Removes default browser styling for consistent cross-browser behavior
overview.normalize: Normalize Styles - Makes browsers render all elements more consistently
overview.baseElements: Base Element Styles - Default styling for common HTML elements
overview.designTokens: Design Tokens - CSS custom properties for colors, spacing, typography, and more

cssReset.title: CSS Reset
cssReset.description: The CSS reset removes default margins, padding, and borders from elements to provide a clean slate for styling.
cssReset.resetElementsDescription: The following elements have their margins and padding reset:
cssReset.scrollbarDescription: Custom scrollbar styles are applied for WebKit browsers and Firefox:

normalize.title: Normalize Styles
normalize.description: Based on normalize.css, these styles ensure cross-browser consistency for HTML elements.

baseElements.title: Base Element Styles
baseElements.description: Default styling applied to HTML elements for a polished look out of the box.

designTokens.title: Design Tokens
designTokens.description: CSS custom properties that define the design system. These can be customized at runtime for theming.

usage.title: Using Design Tokens
usage.description: Design tokens can be used directly in your CSS or inline styles:

darkMode.title: Dark Mode Support
darkMode.description: All base styles automatically adapt to dark mode when enabled. Styles respond to both:
darkMode.elements: Elements like body, headings, links, tables, forms, and code blocks automatically adjust their colors for dark mode.

import.title: Importing Base Styles
import.description: To use the base styles in your project, import the base index file:

apiReference.title: API Reference
apiReference.description: Complete reference for Apex classes and utilities.

searchAvailable.title: Search Available
searchAvailable.content: Use the search box in the sidebar to quickly find specific utilities.

progressiveEnhancement.title: Progressive Enhancement
progressiveEnhancement.content: Apex uses modern CSS features with fallbacks for older browsers.

changelog.title: Changelog
changelog.description: Track changes, updates, and improvements to Apex.

stayUpdated.title: Stay Updated
stayUpdated.description: Subscribe to our GitHub releases to get notified about new versions.

cheatsheet.title: Cheatsheet
cheatsheet.description: Quick reference for Apex utility classes. Print or save this page for offline use.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: Customize Apex to fit your project needs by modifying SCSS variables and feature flags.

scssConfiguration.title: SCSS Configuration
scssConfiguration.content: Apex uses SCSS variables for configuration. Override these variables before importing the framework.

coreSettings.title: Core Settings
coreSettings.description: Configure the fundamental behavior of Apex with these core settings.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Add a custom prefix to all utility classes to avoid naming conflicts:
prefix.note: With this configuration, utility classes will have your custom prefix.

breakpoints.title: Breakpoints
breakpoints.description: Define responsive breakpoints for your project. These are used for responsive utility variants.

featureFlags.title: Feature Flags
featureFlags.description: Enable or disable specific utility categories to reduce CSS bundle size. Set to false to disable utilities you don't need.

spacingScale.title: Spacing Scale
spacingScale.description: Customize the spacing scale used for margin, padding, and gap utilities.
spacingScale.usage: Used by: m-, p-, gap-, space-x-, space-y- utilities

sizingScale.title: Sizing Scale
sizingScale.description: Customize the sizing scale used for width, height, and max/min sizing utilities.
sizingScale.usage: Used by: w-, h-, min-w-, max-w-, min-h-, max-h- utilities

borderRadius.title: Border Radius Scale
borderRadius.description: Customize the border radius scale used for rounded corners.

shadows.title: Shadows
shadows.description: Customize the shadow values used for elevation utilities.

transitions.title: Transitions
transitions.description: Customize transition duration and timing function scales.

customizing.title: Customizing Your Build
customizing.description: Create a custom configuration file to override default values before importing Apex:

bestPractices.title: Configuration Best Practices
bestPractices.practice1: Disable utilities you don't use to reduce CSS bundle size
bestPractices.practice2: Customize breakpoints to match your design requirements
bestPractices.practice3: Use a prefix if integrating Apex with other CSS frameworks
bestPractices.practice4: Keep your custom config file version controlled for team consistency

contributing.title: Contributing
contributing.description: Thank you for your interest in contributing to Apex!

codeOfConduct.title: Code of Conduct
codeOfConduct.content: Please read our Code of Conduct before contributing. We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive experience for everyone.

steps.branch: Create a new branch for your changes

steps.style: Ensure your code follows our style guidelines

customization.title: Customization
customization.description: Learn how to customize Apex CSS framework to match your brand and project requirements using CSS variables and SCSS configuration.

cssVariables.title: CSS Variables
cssVariables.content: Apex uses CSS custom properties (variables) for easy customization. All design tokens are available as CSS variables that you can override in your styles.

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.description: Get started customizing Apex in minutes.
quickStart.intro: The easiest way to customize Apex is by overriding CSS variables. Load your custom styles after importing the framework.

customColors.title: Custom Colors
customColors.description: Override the default color palette to match your brand identity.
customColors.intro: Apex uses semantic color tokens that can be customized by overriding CSS variables. The framework provides both semantic colors (primary, success, warning, error) and neutral grays.
customColors.paletteDescription: Each color has a full palette of shades from 50 (lightest) to 950 (darkest). Override individual shades to fine-tune your color scheme.
customColors.darkModeDescription: For dark mode support, override the same variables within a dark mode selector. Apex supports both class-based (.dark) and data-attribute based ([data-theme="dark"]) dark mode.

customSpacing.title: Custom Spacing
customSpacing.description: Define your own spacing scale for margins, padding, and gaps.
customSpacing.intro: Apex provides a spacing scale based on rem units. All spacing utilities use these CSS variables internally.
customSpacing.noteContent: Spacing in Apex is defined via SCSS maps at build time. While you can override CSS variables for runtime theming, adding new spacing values requires SCSS configuration.

customTypography.title: Custom Typography
customTypography.description: Customize font families, sizes, weights, and line heights.
customTypography.intro: Apex provides a complete typography system with customizable font stacks, size scale, weights, and line heights. All values use CSS variables for easy theming.
customTypography.googleFontsDescription: Load custom fonts from Google Fonts or other CDN sources, then reference them in your CSS variables.

scss.title: SCSS Configuration
scss.description: For advanced customization, use SCSS variables before importing the framework.
scss.intro: Apex is built with SCSS and allows you to customize the framework by setting variables before import. This gives you control over colors, spacing scales, and which features to include.
scss.availableVariablesDescription: These are the main configuration variables you can override before importing Apex:
scss.colorVariablesDescription: Override specific color shades or entire color maps to match your brand:
scss.importantNoteContent: SCSS variables must be set BEFORE importing the Apex framework. Once compiled, these values are baked into the CSS and cannot be changed at runtime.

featureFlags.title: Feature Flags
featureFlags.description: Enable or disable specific utility categories to optimize your bundle size.
featureFlags.intro: Apex allows you to disable utility categories you don't use. This reduces the final CSS bundle size by excluding unused styles.

jsConfig.title: JavaScript Configuration
jsConfig.description: Configure Apex dynamically at runtime using JavaScript.
jsConfig.intro: Apex provides a JavaScript configuration API for runtime theming. This is useful for dynamic theme switching and user preferences.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.description: Follow these guidelines for maintainable and effective customization.
bestPractices.tip1: Define your custom variables in a central location, loaded after the framework.
bestPractices.tip2: Use semantic color names (primary, success, error) rather than literal colors (blue, green, red).
bestPractices.tip3: Test customizations in both light and dark modes.
bestPractices.tip4: Consider using CSS custom properties for values that might change at runtime.
bestPractices.tip5: Document your design token values for team consistency.

darkMode.title: Dark Mode
darkMode.description: Apex provides built-in dark mode support with automatic switching.

automaticDarkMode.title: Automatic Dark Mode
automaticDarkMode.description: Dark mode automatically switches based on the user's system preferences:

darkModeClasses.title: Dark Mode Classes
darkModeClasses.description: Use the dark: prefix to apply styles in dark mode:

customizingDarkMode.title: Customizing Dark Mode
customizingDarkMode.description: Override CSS variables for custom dark mode colors:

designSystem.title: Design System
designSystem.description: Explore the Apex design system with interactive color palettes, spacing scales, typography specimens, and live theme customization. All design tokens use CSS custom properties for easy customization.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: A color system with semantic colors and full palettes. Click any color to copy its CSS variable.
colors.contrastDescription: Check accessibility contrast ratios between colors to ensure WCAG compliance.

typography.title: Typography
typography.description: A complete typography system with font sizes, weights, line heights, and letter spacing. Preview changes live and copy CSS variables.

spacing.title: Spacing
spacing.description: 34 spacing values from 0 to 24rem. Use for margins, padding, gaps, and more. View in list, stack, or comparison modes.

borderRadius.title: Borders & Shadows
borderRadius.description: Border radius and shadow scales for consistent elevation and rounding. Includes individual corner utilities.

shadows.title: Shadows
shadows.description: 8 levels of box shadows from none to 2xl. Use shadows to create depth and elevation in your designs.

themePlayground.title: Theme Playground
themePlayground.description: Customize colors, border radius, and shadows in real-time. Copy the generated CSS to use in your project.

cssVariables.title: CSS Variables
cssVariables.description: All Apex design tokens are available as CSS custom properties. Override them to customize your theme.

quickReference.title: Quick Reference
quickReference.description: Quick lookup table for common utility class patterns and their CSS equivalents.

whatIs.question: What is Apex?
whatIs.answer: Apex is a utility-first CSS framework with 500+ utility classes designed for rapid UI development. It provides a set of low-level utility classes that let you build completely custom designs without leaving your HTML.

productionReady.question: Is Apex production-ready?
productionReady.answer: Yes! Apex is stable and production-ready. It is used by many projects in production environments.

newSyntax.question: Do I need to learn a new syntax?
newSyntax.answer: No, Apex uses standard CSS class names. If you are familiar with utility-first CSS, you will feel right at home.

customize.question: Can I customize the framework?
customize.answer: Absolutely! Apex is highly customizable through CSS variables and configuration options. You can change colors, spacing scales, and more.

darkMode.question: Does Apex support dark mode?
darkMode.answer: Yes, Apex has built-in dark mode support with the dark: variant prefix, making it easy to style your components for both light and dark themes.

rtl.question: Is there RTL support?
rtl.answer: Yes, Apex includes full RTL (Right-to-Left) support for internationalization.

gettingStarted.description: Learn how to get started with Apex

mobileFirst.content: Apex follows a mobile-first approach. Base styles apply to all screen sizes, and breakpoints target larger screens.

pluginApi.title: Plugin API
pluginApi.content: The plugin API is currently in beta. APIs may change in future releases.

creatingPlugin.title: Creating a Plugin
creatingPlugin.description: Create a JavaScript file that exports a plugin object:

performance.title: Performance
performance.description: Best practices for optimal performance with Apex.

buildOptimization.title: Build Optimization
buildOptimization.content: Apex automatically purges unused styles in production builds.

fileSize.title: File Size
fileSize.content: The full Apex build is approximately 15KB minified and gzipped. With purging enabled, your CSS bundle will only include the utilities you actually use.

purgecss.title: PurgeCSS
purgecss.content: Apex uses PurgeCSS to remove unused styles. Configure your purge options in the configuration file.

whatIs.title: What is PurgeCSS?
whatIs.description: PurgeCSS analyzes your content files (HTML, JSX, Vue, etc.) and removes unused CSS rules. This can reduce your CSS bundle size by 80-95%.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: Create a purgecss.config.js file in your project root to configure PurgeCSS.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: Install PurgeCSS as a PostCSS plugin or standalone tool.

postcss.title: PostCSS Integration
postcss.description: Integrate PurgeCSS with your PostCSS build pipeline.

safelist.title: Safelist Configuration
safelist.description: Define patterns for classes that should never be removed, even if they appear unused. This is important for dynamic classes and JavaScript-generated content.

buildIntegration.title: Build Tool Integration
buildIntegration.description: PurgeCSS can be integrated with popular build tools like Vite, webpack, and Rollup.

cli.title: CLI Usage
cli.description: Use the PurgeCSS CLI to process CSS files directly from the command line.

bestPractices.title: PurgeCSS Best Practices
bestPractices.practice1: Always safelist accessibility utilities like sr-only and focus-visible
bestPractices.practice2: Safelist dynamic classes that are added via JavaScript
bestPractices.practice3: Include all template files in the content array
bestPractices.practice4: Test your site thoroughly after purging to ensure no styles are missing
bestPractices.practice5: Use regex patterns for safelist to match multiple variants

steps.cdn: Use the CDN for prototyping, npm for production
steps.disable: Disable utilities you do not need
steps.components: Use custom components for repeated patterns

rtl.title: RTL Support
rtl.description: Apex includes built-in RTL (Right-to-Left) support for internationalization. Perfect for Arabic, Hebrew, and other RTL languages.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.content: Apex uses logical properties that automatically adapt to the document direction. When you set dir="rtl" on your HTML element, all utilities with directional properties will flip automatically.

layout.title: RTL Layout
layout.description: See how layout utilities automatically flip in RTL mode.

spacing.title: RTL Spacing
spacing.description: Margin and padding utilities automatically adapt to text direction.

flexbox.title: RTL Flexbox
flexbox.description: Flexbox layouts maintain their visual structure in RTL mode.

textAlignment.title: RTL Text Alignment
textAlignment.description: Text alignment utilities work with logical properties.

reactNextjs.title: 2. React/Next.js with next-intl
reactNextjs.automaticallyHandles: Automatically handles RTL for Arabic and Hebrew
reactNextjs.dirAttributeSet: The dir attribute is set based on locale

importantConsiderations.title: Important Considerations
importantConsiderations.useLogical: Use logical properties (start/end) when possible for better RTL support
importantConsiderations.iconsImages: Icons and images may need manual adjustment in RTL layouts
importantConsiderations.testWithActual: Test with actual RTL content, not just flipped LTR text
importantConsiderations.considerBidirectional: Consider bidirectional text with mixed content

badges.title: Badges
badges.description: Badges are small count and labeling components used to highlight additional information.

basicBadge.title: Basic Badge

colorVariants.title: Color Variants
colorVariants.description: Badges are available in different color variants.

sizes.description: Badges are available in different sizes.

withIcons.title: With Icons
withIcons.description: Badges can include icons for additional context.

notificationBadge.title: Notification Badge

tables.description: Tables are used to display data in rows and columns with various styling options.

disabledTab.title: Disabled Tab

modals.title: Modals
modals.description: Modals are dialog boxes that appear on top of the page content to focus user attention on important information or actions.

centeredModal.title: Centered Modal

confirmationModal.title: Confirmation Modal

dropdowns.title: Dropdowns
dropdowns.description: Dropdowns are toggleable, contextual overlays for displaying lists of links and more.

basicDropdown.title: Basic Dropdown

dropdownWithDivider.title: Dropdown with Divider
dropdownWithDivider.description: Add dividers to separate dropdown menu items into groups.

dropdownWithIcons.title: Dropdown with Icons

dropdownWithHeader.title: Dropdown with Header
dropdownWithHeader.description: Add a header section to the dropdown for additional context.

dropdownPositions.title: Dropdown Positions
dropdownPositions.description: Position the dropdown menu in different directions.

dropdownSizes.title: Dropdown Sizes
dropdownSizes.description: Dropdowns are available in different sizes.

splitButtonDropdown.title: Split Button Dropdown
splitButtonDropdown.description: A button with a separate dropdown trigger.

accordion.title: Accordion
accordion.description: Accordions are vertically stacked elements that can be expanded and collapsed to show or hide content.

basicAccordion.title: Basic Accordion
basicAccordion.description: A simple accordion with expandable and collapsible items.

accordionWithIcons.title: Accordion with Icons
accordionWithIcons.description: Add icons to accordion headers for visual context.

flushAccordion.title: Flush Accordion
flushAccordion.description: Accordion without borders for a cleaner look.

alwaysOpenAccordion.title: Always Open Accordion
alwaysOpenAccordion.description: Allow multiple accordion items to be open at the same time.

accordionWithDescription.title: Accordion with Description
accordionWithDescription.description: Add a description below the accordion title.

compactAccordion.title: Compact Accordion
compactAccordion.description: A more compact accordion with reduced padding.

accentColor.title: Accent Color
accentColor.description: Accent color utilities for styling form controls like checkboxes, radio buttons, and progress bars.

basicUsage.title: Basic Usage
basicUsage.description: Use accent color utilities to style form controls with semantic colors.

availableColors.title: Available Colors
availableColors.description: Choose from a range of semantic and utility colors:

supportedElements.title: Supported Elements
supportedElements.description: Accent color affects these form controls:

backgrounds.title: Backgrounds
backgrounds.description: Background utilities for controlling background images, gradients, clip, origin, position, repeat, and size.

backgroundAttachment.title: Background Attachment
backgroundAttachment.description: Control how a background image behaves when scrolling:

backgroundClip.title: Background Clip
backgroundClip.description: Control how background extends beyond element padding:

backgroundPosition.title: Background Position
backgroundPosition.description: Position background images within their container.

gradients.title: Gradients
gradients.description: Create linear gradients with directional modifiers.

gradientColors.title: Gradient Colors
gradientColors.description: Use from-*, via-*, and to-* utilities to define gradient colors.

blendModes.title: Blend Modes
blendModes.description: Blend mode utilities for controlling how elements blend with their backdrop.

basicUsage.title: Basic Usage
basicUsage.description: Apply blend modes to elements using mix-blend-* or bg-blend-* utilities.

mixBlendMode.title: Mix Blend Mode
mixBlendMode.description: Controls how an element blends with elements behind it:

bgBlendMode.title: Background Blend Mode
bgBlendMode.description: Controls how background images blend with each other:

break.title: Break
break.description: Break utilities for controlling page breaks and column breaks in print and multi-column layouts.

printNote.title: Print Styles
printNote.content: These utilities are most useful for print stylesheets and multi-column layouts.

breakInside.title: Break Inside
breakInside.description: Control how page/column breaks within an element:

breakBefore.title: Break Before
breakBefore.description: Control page/column breaks before an element:

breakAfter.title: Break After
breakAfter.description: Control page/column breaks after an element:

cursor.title: Cursor
cursor.description: Cursor utilities for controlling the mouse cursor display.

basicUsage.title: Basic Usage
basicUsage.description: Use cursor utilities to indicate interactive elements or specific actions.

availableCursors.title: Available Cursors
availableCursors.description: Choose from a wide variety of cursor styles:

typography.title: Typography
typography.description: Typography utilities for controlling font size, weight, line height, alignment, and more.

fontSizes.title: Font Sizes
fontSizes.description: Control the font size of an element using the text-size utilities.

fontWeights.title: Font Weights
fontWeights.description: Control the font weight of an element.

lineHeights.title: Line Heights
lineHeights.description: Control the line height of an element.

textAlignments.title: Text Alignment
textAlignments.description: Control the text alignment of an element.

textDecoration.title: Text Decoration
textDecoration.description: Control the text decoration of an element.

letterSpacing.title: Letter Spacing
letterSpacing.description: Control the letter spacing of an element.

textColors.title: Text Colors
textColors.description: Control the text color of an element.

sizing.title: Sizing
sizing.description: Sizing utilities for controlling the width, height, and max-width/max-height of elements.

width.title: Width
width.description: Control the width of an element using width utilities.

fixedWidth.title: Fixed Width
fixedWidth.description: Set a fixed width using spacing scale values.

maxWidth.title: Max Width
maxWidth.description: Control the maximum width of an element.

height.title: Height
height.description: Control the height of an element using height utilities.

fixedHeight.title: Fixed Height
fixedHeight.description: Set a fixed height using spacing scale values.

maxHeight.title: Max Height
maxHeight.description: Control the maximum height of an element.

aspectRatio.title: Aspect Ratio
aspectRatio.description: Control the aspect ratio of an element.

borders.title: Borders
borders.description: Border utilities for controlling border width, sides, radius, colors, and dividers.

borderWidth.title: Border Width
borderWidth.description: Add borders to elements with different widths.

borderSides.title: Border Sides
borderSides.description: Add borders to specific sides of an element.

positioning.title: Positioning
positioning.description: Positioning utilities for controlling element position, z-index, and inset values.

positionTypes.title: Position Types
positionTypes.description: Control how an element is positioned in the document flow.

inset.title: Inset
inset.description: Shorthand for setting top, right, bottom, and left properties simultaneously.

top.title: Top
top.description: Set the vertical position of a positioned element from the top.

right.title: Right
right.description: Set the horizontal position of a positioned element from the right.

bottom.title: Bottom
bottom.description: Set the vertical position of a positioned element from the bottom.

left.title: Left
left.description: Set the horizontal position of a positioned element from the left.

zIndex.title: Z-Index
zIndex.description: Control the stack order of positioned elements.

display.title: Display
display.description: Display utilities for controlling the display property of elements.

basicDisplay.title: Basic Display Values
basicDisplay.description: Control the display type of an element.

flexGrid.title: Flex and Grid
flexGrid.description: Display utilities for flexbox and grid layouts.

otherDisplay.title: Other Display Values
otherDisplay.description: Additional display utilities for special use cases.

responsive.title: Responsive Display
responsive.description: Apply display utilities at specific breakpoints.

opacity.title: Opacity
opacity.description: Opacity utilities for controlling the transparency of elements.

opacityScale.title: Opacity Scale
opacityScale.description: Control the opacity/transparency of an element from 0 (invisible) to 100 (fully opaque).

responsive.title: Responsive Opacity
responsive.description: Apply opacity utilities at specific breakpoints.

shadows.title: Shadows
shadows.description: Shadow utilities for controlling box shadows and elevation.

shadowScale.title: Shadow Scale
shadowScale.description: Apply box shadows to elements with different sizes and intensities.

shadowColors.title: Shadow Colors
shadowColors.description: Customize the color of box shadows.

responsive.title: Responsive Shadows
responsive.description: Apply shadow utilities at specific breakpoints.

transitions.title: Transitions & Animations
transitions.description: Transition and animation utilities for controlling element transitions, timing, and animations.

transitionProperty.title: Transition Property
transitionProperty.description: Specify which CSS properties should transition.

timing.title: Transition Timing
timing.description: Control the timing function (easing) of transitions.

delay.title: Transition Delay
delay.description: Add a delay before the transition starts.

animations.title: Animations
animations.description: Built-in animations for common use cases.

spin.title: Spin Animation
spin.description: Continuous rotation animation, perfect for loading indicators.

ping.title: Ping Animation
ping.description: Scale and fade animation, ideal for notification badges.

pulse.title: Pulse Animation
pulse.description: Opacity pulse animation, great for skeleton loaders.

responsive.title: Responsive Transitions
responsive.description: Apply transition utilities at specific breakpoints.

reducedMotion.title: Reduced Motion Support
reducedMotion.description: Respect user preferences for reduced motion using motion-reduce utilities.

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: Visibility utilities for controlling element visibility without affecting layout.

visibilityValues.title: Visibility Values
visibilityValues.description: Control whether an element is visible or invisible.

vsDisplay.title: Visibility vs Display
vsDisplay.description: Understanding the difference between visibility and display utilities.

responsive.title: Responsive Visibility
responsive.description: Apply visibility utilities at specific breakpoints.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common issues and how to resolve them.

needMoreHelp.title: Need more help?
needMoreHelp.content: If you cannot find a solution here, please check the FAQ or join our community Discord.

stylesNotApplying.title: Styles not applying
stylesNotApplying.solution: Make sure you have imported the Apex CSS file in your project. Check that the path to the CSS file is correct.

darkModeNotWorking.title: Dark mode not working
darkModeNotWorking.solution: Ensure you have the dark class on your HTML element or that your system preference is set to dark mode.

customColorsNotAppearing.title: Custom colors not appearing
customColorsNotAppearing.solution: Check your configuration file and make sure you have rebuilt the CSS after making changes.

rtlLayoutIssues.title: RTL layout issues
rtlLayoutIssues.solution: Verify that you have set dir="rtl" on your HTML element and are using RTL-aware utilities like ms- and me- instead of ml- and mr-.

buildErrors.title: Build errors
buildErrors.solution: Make sure you have the latest version of Apex installed. Try deleting node_modules and running npm install again.

feedback.title: Was this helpful?
feedback.placeholder: Tell us more about your experience...

playground.title: Playground
playground.description: Try Apex utilities directly in your browser. Edit the HTML and see the result instantly.
playground.tabIndent: Press Tab to indent and Shift+Tab to outdent

rtl.title: RTL Support
rtl.description: Apex includes built-in RTL (Right-to-Left) support for internationalization.

search.searchFor: Search for utilities, components, guides, and more

home.title: Apex
home.description: A utility-first CSS framework with 500+ utility classes for rapid UI development.

welcomeAlert.title: Welcome!
welcomeAlert.content: Welcome to the Apex documentation. This utility-first framework provides a large set of CSS classes for rapid UI development, including spacing, typography, colors, flexbox, grid, animations, transforms, filters, and much more.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Get started with Apex by including it in your project.

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.description: Include the framework CSS file in your HTML:

utilities.title: Utilities
utilities.description: The framework includes a wide range of utility classes for spacing, typography, colors, flexbox, grid, and more.
utilities.exploreAlert: These are just a few examples. Explore the Utilities section to see all available classes.

components.title: Components
components.description: Apex provides a collection of pre-built components for common UI patterns.

themes.title: Themes
themes.description: Apex includes built-in support for light, dark, and custom themes.

darkMode.title: Dark Mode
darkMode.description: Enable automatic dark mode or configure custom themes:

customThemes.title: Custom Themes
customThemes.description: Create your own theme by overriding CSS variables:

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Apex prioritizes accessibility with built-in support for screen readers, focus management, and keyboard navigation.

screenReaderClasses.title: Screen Reader Classes
screenReaderClasses.description: Hide content visually while keeping it accessible to assistive technologies:

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: Customize Apex by modifying the configuration file to enable or disable utilities, change prefixes, and more.

responsiveDesign.title: Responsive Design
responsiveDesign.description: Build responsive layouts with Apex utility classes.

mobileFirst.title: Mobile-First
mobileFirst.content: Apex follows a mobile-first approach. Base styles apply to all screen sizes, and breakpoints target larger screens.

responsiveModifiers.title: Responsive Modifiers
responsiveModifiers.description: Use responsive prefixes to apply styles at specific breakpoints:

responsiveTypography.title: Responsive Typography
responsiveTypography.description: Adjust text size based on viewport:

hideShowElements.title: Hide/Show Elements
hideShowElements.description: Show or hide elements at different breakpoints:

rtl.title: RTL Support
rtl.description: Apex includes built-in RTL (Right-to-Left) support for internationalization. Perfect for Arabic, Hebrew, and other RTL languages.

forms.title: Forms
forms.description: Form components including inputs, labels, checkboxes, and validation states.

interactiveDemo.title: Interactive Form Demo
interactiveDemo.description: Customize input variants, sizes, and states.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: Explore the complete color palette. Click any color to copy its class name.

flexbox.title: Flexbox
flexbox.description: Flexbox utilities for creating flexible and responsive layouts.

interactivePlayground.title: Interactive Flexbox Playground
interactivePlayground.description: Experiment with different flexbox properties and see the results in real-time.

grid.title: Grid
grid.description: Interactive grid builder. Customize columns, gaps, and generate CSS Grid code instantly.

basicGrid.title: Basic Grid
basicGrid.description: Create a basic grid with equal-width columns.

responsiveGrid.title: Responsive Grid
responsiveGrid.description: Use responsive prefixes to change the number of columns at different breakpoints.

autoFitGrid.title: Auto-fit Grid
autoFitGrid.description: Create a responsive grid that automatically adjusts columns based on minimum item width.

spacing.title: Spacing
spacing.description: Interactive spacing explorer. Adjust the controls to see how different spacing values affect your layout.
